intro: Xyris zombana, commonly known as the Zombana yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Xyris zombana is an important part of the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
